p: The starch content in flour from raw red and black-eye seeds, i.e. 50.4 and 49.8 g/100 g DW, respectively, is comparable to the 39–50% reported by Poulter [ 42], but lower than the 56.9–58.3 g/100 g DW reported by Deshpande, Sathe [ 43]. This dissimilarity is attributed to varietal differences [ 42], cultivation conditions [ 44] and analytical methods [ 15]. In comparison to other legumes, total starch content was comparable to the 41–44% in raw lentil, chickpea and red kidney beans [ 45], but higher than the 31–38% in raw cowpea [ 46].
